titleStmt.title: Territory of Washington v. Thomas P. Overnalls. Petition

bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Thomas P. Overnalls. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: before the Hon. CC. Hewitt, Judge of said district and chief Justice of the _____ County of said Jefferson at chambers in Port Townsend W. T.
Your petitioner, Cleb W. Miller, on behalf of T Nelson Overnalls, a male child about 14 months old now in the County of Island W. T. respectfully represents
That the said T. Nelson Overnalls is restrained of his liberty in the county of Island W.T. by one Thomas P Overnal, The Father of said child.
That the cause of said restraint is a disagrement between the Father and Mother of said child. The mother being the wife of said Thos P. Overnalls, all of the County of Island W.T.

That the inapropriatnes and illegality of said restraint consists
In the following facts that said child is of tender age and needs the care and attentions of its mother and was forcefully taken from her custody by the father in the manner and at the time and place, and under the circumstances stated in the afidavits here to ammended.
That the father and mother are living seperated and apart, and that the Mother is the more competent and suitable person under the enviroments to have the custody of said infant child

wherefore your petitioners prays that a writ of Habeas Courpus may be issued directed to the said Thomas P. Overnalls commanding him to have the said infant child, Nelson Overnalls, before your Honor at Port Townsend W. T. forthwith after issue of this writ to the said Thos
the circumstances of the case or that the said Thomas P. Overnalls than and there show cause why he has not done so.

and your petition further represents that he has been informed that said Thomas P Overnalls has threatened to remove said child out of the County where he cannot be found, and your Petitioner has reason to belive he will do so unless a provocated

Wherefor your pettiition further prays that a warant may issue to the Sheriff of said County of Island commanding him to arrest said child forthwith, and to bring him before your Honor at the time & place above known or if it be inproper in the opinion of the officer to do so on account of the thender age of the child, then to deliver said child to the custody of its mother
There to remain until the further order of your Honor and that said Sheriff makes return of his doings forthwith
Subscribed & sworn to before me this 27 day of October 1862
